isis.stitle: Recall 95503 - Rockwell WABCO System Saver 1000 Air Dryer, or Rockwell WABCO System Saver Twin Air Dryer (Sold Through Service Parts) - 2000, 3000, 4000, 5000, 8000 and 9000 Models

recall.subject: Rockwell WABCO System Saver 1000 Air Dryer, or Rockwell WABCO System Saver Twin Air Dryer (Sold Through Service Parts) - 2000, 3000, 4000, 5000, 8000 and 9000 Models

defect.para: This Recall applies to 2000, 3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, and 9000 models built from 03/24/1993 through 03/07/1995 with code 04EAT Rockwell WABCO System 1000 Air Dryer.

Air systems are designed so that when adequate air pressure is reached in the brake system air reservoirs, a signal is sent to the air compressor governor which actuates the unloader valve, stopping the air flow from the compressor.

Rockwell WABCO has informed Navistar of a potential problem with the Rockwell WABCO System Saver 1000 or System Saver Twin Air Dryers because of no protective pressure relief valve between the air compressor and the air dryer. In the event of a blockage in the air dryer, or in the line between the air dryer and the supply reservoir, air would not be replenished in the reservoirs. This in turn would prevent the air compressor from receiving a signal to shut off at a predetermined air pressure level. Under this circumstance, air pressure would continue to build in the air dryer.

Excessive pressure in the air dryer could result in the air dryer cartridge rupturing and separating from its mounting base and could result in property damage or injury to persons nearby who may be struck by pieces of the air dryer cartridge.
The remedy for this defect is to install a pressure relief valve between the air compressor and the air dryer.

note.para: Also involved are four different part numbers of Rockwell WABCO air dryers which were sold through the Navistar Parts System or the Rockwell WABCO Direct Ship program.

Rockwell WABCO System Saver 1000 Air Dryer (12 volt)

defect.para: The dealer should check his records for customers who purchased these dryers and contact the customers to bring their vehicles in to have the recall performed.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE

step1.para: Operate engine until air compressor reaches cutout pressure and air dryer has completed the purge cycle.
Turn engine off and chock wheels.
Exhaust air from all air reservoirs.
Remove the air compressor air supply line from "Inlet" port #1 of the air dryer. See Figure 1.
Remove pipe-to-hose adapter fitting from "Inlet" port. Save fitting for re-installation.

Using street tee from repair kit, screw male end of tee into "Inlet" port #1 of air dryer so that 1/2 inch (or 3/8 inch) female pipe thread of tee faces up or within 30 degrees of vertical. See Figure 2.
Screw the pressure relief valve into vertical port of street tee. Do not exceed torque of 30 ft-lbs. for 3/8 inch thread, or 65 ft-lbs. for 1/2 inch thread.
Install pipe-to-hose adapter fitting removed in Step 5 into female port on end of the street tee.
Install air line removed in Step 4 to adapter fitting in tee.

svcproc.para: Be sure to check the inlet and outlet connections from the compressor to the Dryer and from the Dryer to the supply reservoir. Re-position and/or support any low spots found in the air lines to reduce the possibility of condensation collecting and freezing.

svcproc.title: OPERATIONAL CHECKS
svcproc.para: Once the modification is complete, start the engine, build up air pressure to 100 psi, and shut off the engine. Check for air leaks at the inlet and outlet of the dryer. Correct any leakage. Restart the engine and build up pressure to cut-out pressure. At cut-out pressure the air dryer purge valve opens and immediately expels a large volume of air, followed by a slow flow of air lasting approximately thirty seconds. Check for leakage at locations listed below to assure that the Rockwell WABCO System Saver 1000 Air Dryer does not cycle excessively.

item.para: Drain Cock and Pressure Relief Valve in Supply Reservoir.
All air connections leading to and from the supply reservoir.

entry.para: Install pressure relief valve kit in air dryer

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward. The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair the vehicle as soon as possible.
